snippet: Two senators are warning that dealings by Huawei, the Chinese telecommunications firm, could allow the Chinese government access to the networks of South Korea, an American ally.
abstract: Senators Dianne Feinstein and Robert Menendez ask Obama administration to warn South Korea against allowing Chinese telecommunications firm Huawei to build large parts of a next-generation network for Seoul; they say it could give China entry points into the telecommunications networks and Web traffic of an important American ally.
lead_paragraph: Two senators are warning that dealings by Huawei, the Chinese telecommunications firm, could allow the Chinese government access to the networks of South Korea, an American ally.

headline.main: U.S. Senators Say South Korea Should Not Hire China Firm
headline.print_headline: Senators Say South Korea Should Not Hire China Firm
